716987f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Exchange Place
716987f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, south from Exchange Place to Battery Place,
showing the Aldrich Court at No. 41-45. Note the New ork Bank Note
Company in the Washington Building, No. 1 Broadway.
About 1885.
Brown Brothers.

716988f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Exchange Place
716988f-a.text:
Broadway, south across Exchange Place, and showing
the Consolidated Stock and Petroleum Exchange Building
at the N. E. corner. This building was erected in 1887
-1888. In 19P2 it was occupied by the Columbia Trust Co.
The low building beyond is the Arcade Building.
About 1890
Thru New York Historical Society
MAY BE REPPDDUCED
Ne. ~18477, 1-472

716993f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Exchange Place
716993f.text:
Broadway, at the N. E. corner of Exchange Place, showing
the Consolidated Stock and Petroleum Exchange Building (erected
in 1887-8). For details of this organization see page 792 of Kings
Handbook of N. Y. (1893). THe 22 story Columbia Trust Company
Building suc eeded to this site.
On the right is an extensive view eastward on Exchange Place,
across New, Broad and William Streets. Note the low buildings to
the rear of this structure. These were subsequently rem ved for
the Blair and Mackey Buildings during the building controwersy
between these individuals.
About 1890
Ewing Galloway
NO RRPRODUCTIO8S

716984f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Exchange Alley
716984f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from and including Exchange Alley, to but not
including Thames Street, showing prominently the 32 story Adama Building
(No. 57-61 Broadway) at the N.W. corner of Exchange Alley.
about 1920
Edwin Levick

716986f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Exchange Place
716986f-a.text:
Broadway (center, street level not shown) at Exchange Place
(center to riht rargin) and Exchange Alley (center to left bordwr),
cRr1eo 3 corners of this intersection; the southwesterly being
obscured by the Exchange Court (foreground, S.E. corner). The
larae 32 story structure is the Adams Buildina and the 23, the
Columbia Trust Co. Bldg. The photographer is viewing northwestward
to Broadway from atop No. 50 Broad Street.
September 16, 1931.
P.L. Sperr

716960f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Exchange Alley
716960f.text:
Broadway, north from Bowling Green to Exchange Alley as seen from
the U.S. Custom House and across the Green.  About 1935.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
Neg ~2317

716980f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Exchange Place
716980f-a.text:
50-44, 42 and 34-32 Broadway, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner
of Exchange Place, showing the 4-story Standard Arcade, No. 50-44, prior
to demolition. On the extreme right appears a portion of the Custom House.
No. 50 was the site of the first skyscraper, the Tower Building, a 12-
story steel structure erected in 1888 and demolished in 1914. The Standard
Arcade Building bore an insoription to that effect. A 36 story structure
occupies this site since 1927. For further information see, The New York
Sun, Saturday September 4, 1937.
1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

716983f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Exchange Place
716983f-a.text:
50-44 Broadway, adjoining the S.E. corner of Exchange Place, showing
the Arcade Building. Prior to the erection of this structure in 1914;
the 12-story Tower Building stood at No. 50. This was the first steel
structure in New York and was erected in 1888.
1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
